	 function loadScript(scriptURL){
        // load script
        var scriptTAG = document.createElement('script');
        scriptTAG.type = 'application/javascript';
        scriptTAG.async = true;
        scriptTAG.src = scriptURL;
        document.getElementsByTagName('head')[0].appendChild(scriptTAG);
      }

      function loadCSS(CSSURL){
        // load css
        var linkTAG = document.createElement('link');
        linkTAG.rel = "stylesheet";
        linkTAG.type = 'text/css';
        linkTAG.href = CSSURL;
        document.getElementsByTagName('head')[0].appendChild(linkTAG);
      }
      if(!navigator.onLine){
      	loadCSS('/etc.clientlibs/shared/clientlibs/clientlib-base.min.css');
        loadCSS('/etc.clientlibs/shared/clientlibs/clientlib-site.min.css');
        loadScript('/etc.clientlibs/shared/clientlibs/clientlib-base.min.js');

      		loadCSS('/etc.clientlibs/shared/clientlibs/clientlib-site/templates/clientlib-site-event-details.min.css');

        // for blog post template

      		loadCSS('/etc.clientlibs/shared/clientlibs/clientlib-site/templates/clientlib-site-blog-post.min.css')
      	}
        // for DI Article and multimedia
        else if(templateType == "Deloitte_Insights_Article_And_Multimedia_Template"){
          loadCSS('/etc.clientlibs/deloitte-insights/clientlibs/clientlib-critical/clientlib-critical-di-insights-and-multimedia.min.css');

                                                            <div class="row">
                                                                <h2 class="col-sm-12 col-10 h-1 trends-heading font-weight-light font-family-open">Top trends across geographies</h2>
                                                                <p class="col-lg-8 col-12 trends-list-desc font-family-open">
                                                                    Deloitte’s <i>Digital media trends</i> expands beyond the US market in 2022, uncovering insights from Brazil, Germany, Japan, and the United Kingdom. This year’s survey
                                                                    results reveal significant—and often striking—shifts in consumer behavior around the world. Here are the top trends:
                                                                </p>

                                                        <div id="start-trends-modal"></div>
                                                        <div class="trends-overlay trends-overlay-modal" id="trend-modal-1">
                                                            <div class="trends-container">
                                                                <div class="container">
                                                                    <div class="row justify-content-center h-100 align-content-center">
                                                                        <div class="define-trend-section">

                                                                                <div class="define-trend container no-padding">
                                                                                    <div class="col-6 trend-text trend-element trend-element-top">
                                                                                        <p class="trend-no">TREND ONE</p>
                                                                                        <p class="col-9 no-padding trend-item">Streaming video’s retention struggles continue</p>
                                                                                        <div class="trends-desc">
                                                                                            <p>
                                                                                                Watching TV and movies at home remained the top entertainment choice among respondents overall, but many—especially younger generations—are
                                                                                                getting frustrated with their SVOD services. Chasing content across many services and losing content when it leaves a service were top
                                                                                                complaints.
                                                                                            </p>
                                                                                            <p>
                                                                                                Gen Zs were most focused on reigning in costs and are among those most likely to <i>churn</i>: They either cancelled a subscription, or added
                                                                                                and cancelled a subscription, over the past six months. Across the countries surveyed, younger consumers often cancel and then resubscribe to
                                                                                                watch the latest content.
                                                                                            </p>
                                                                                        </div>
                                                                                        <a tabindex="4" role="button" aria-label="read the report" class="btn-arrow-right read-btn sum-url" href="/us/en/insights/industry/technology/digital-media-trends-consumption-habits-survey/summary.html" target="_blank" data-analytics-label="streaming-videos-retention-struggles-continue:read-the-report">

                                                                                        <p class="trend-no">TREND TWO</p>
                                                                                        <p class="col-10 no-padding trend-item">Consumers want more SVOD content and pricing options</p>
                                                                                        <div class="trends-desc">
                                                                                            <p>
                                                                                                SVOD providers could go down several paths to help reduce churn and overall frustration. US consumers are looking for flexibility in
                                                                                                subscription plan pricing and newer content. More than half say they’d be willing to put up with some ads in exchange for cheaper, or free,
                                                                                                subscriptions.
                                                                                            </p>
                                                                                            <p>
                                                                                                Others are looking for a tiered approach to content access. And Gen Zs and Millennials like bundles: 51% would be convinced to keep a streaming
                                                                                                video subscription if their service bundled a gaming or music service or another SVOD service.
                                                                                            </p>
                                                                                        </div>

                                                                            <p class="trend-no">TREND TWO</p>
                                                                            <p class="trend-item">Consumers want more SVOD content and pricing options</p>
                                                                            <div class="trends-desc">
                                                                                <p>
                                                                                    SVOD providers could go down several paths to help reduce churn and overall frustration. US consumers are looking for flexibility in subscription plan
                                                                                    pricing and newer content. More than half say they’d be willing to put up with some ads in exchange for cheaper, or free, subscriptions.
                                                                                </p>
                                                                                <p>
                                                                                    Others are looking for a tiered approach to content access. And Gen Zs and Millennials like bundles: 51% would be convinced to keep a streaming video
                                                                                    subscription if their service bundled a gaming or music service or another SVOD service.
                                                                                </p>
                                                                            </div>
                                                                        </div>

                                                                                        <p class="trend-no">TREND THREE</p>
                                                                                        <p class="col-9 no-padding trend-item">Consumers are eating up user-generated content (UGC)</p>
                                                                                        <div class="trends-desc">
                                                                                            <p>
                                                                                                About 80% of US social media users are on these sites at least daily. Many are snacking on user-generated content (UGC)—free, bite-sized videos
                                                                                                that are available anytime, anywhere.
                                                                                            </p>
                                                                                            <p>
                                                                                                UGC has become a time-filler; many consumers find the stream of algorithm-fueled, personalized videos irresistible. And it’s competing for
                                                                                                attention with other entertainment activities: In the US, roughly half say they watch more user-generated content than they did six months ago,
                                                                                                and half always spend more time watching UGC than they had planned—while 70% of Gen Zs have trouble pulling themselves away.
                                                                                            </p>
                                                                                        </div>

                                                                                        <p class="col-9 no-padding trend-item">Influencers boost social commerce around the world</p>
                                                                                        <div class="trends-desc">
                                                                                            <p>
                                                                                                Popular content creators can become influencers—users with large followings whose lifestyle and product recommendations can become powerful
                                                                                                sales enablers. Partnering with the right influencers can help brands tap into desired communities and, increasingly, sell, sell, sell.
                                                                                            </p>
                                                                                            <p>
                                                                                                Influencers have clout around the world: 88% of respondents in Brazil follow an influencer, as do 79% of respondents from Japan. In the US,
                                                                                                one-third (and more than 50% of Gen Zs and Millennials) say they influence their buying decisions.
                                                                                            </p>

                                                                                        <div class="trends-desc">
                                                                                            <p>
                                                                                                Gaming is entering a new phase of growth and popularity. About half of gamers in the US say gaming has taken time away from other entertainment
                                                                                                activities: More than 80% say they play games frequently or occasionally and half of smartphone owners play on a smartphone daily. Gen Z and
                                                                                                Millennial gamers play the most (averaging 11 hours and 13 hours a week, respectively), but Gen X is close behind, averaging 10 hours a week.
                                                                                            </p>
                                                                                            <p>
                                                                                                Numbers were similar among other countries: Most respondents in the United Kingdom (75%), Germany (78%), Brazil (89%), and Japan (63%) play
                                                                                                video games frequently or occasionally.

                                                                        <p class="col-12 col-xl-10 mx-auto text-center">

    function getCookie(name) 
    {
        var dc = document.cookie;
        var prefix = name + "=";
        var begin = dc.indexOf("; " + prefix);
        if (begin == -1) {
            begin = dc.indexOf(prefix);
            if (begin != 0) return null;
        }
        else
        {
            begin += 2;
            var end = document.cookie.indexOf(";", begin);
            if (end == -1) {
                end = dc.length;
            }
        }
        return unescape(dc.substring(begin + prefix.length, end));
    }

var apiCallFunction = function () {

    var cacheBustDate = new Date();
    var dmdburl = "//api.company-target.com/api/v2/ip.json?key=M65mmM3vaL3giOy4cNEWnOAuvqHh83eUMjTyVFvM&x=" +
        cacheBustDate.getMilliseconds();
    dmdApiCall = "true";


    $.ajax({
        url: dmdburl,
        dataType: "jsonp",
        timeout: 5000,
        success: function (dmdbResult) {
            dmdbDtmData = dmdbResult;
            //Add a signal to indicate that Demandbase was refreshed with this page load
            dmdbDtmData.cache = "false";
            if (typeof dmdbDtmData.company_name !== 'undefined') {

                //Now save to Session Storage
                try {
                    if (guid != null && guid != "" && guid != undefined) {
                        if (cookieCategories.indexOf(",2,") > -1) {
                            window.localStorage.setItem("dmdbDtm", JSON.stringify(dmdbDtmData));
                        }
                    } else window.localStorage.setItem("dmdbDtm", JSON.stringify(dmdbDtmData));
                } catch (err) {}



            }
            setVariables();
            //Update the Data Layer
            try {
                //console.log("in call");
                dmdDataLayer.dmd = dmdbDtmData;
                //console.log("dmdDataLayer.dmd:",dmdDataLayer.dmd)
                dataLayer.dmd = dmdbDtmData;

            } catch (err) {
                if (err.name == 'ReferenceError') {
                    setTimeout(function () {
                        try {
                            dataLayer.dmd = dmdbDtmData;
                        } catch (error) {
                            if (error.name == 'ReferenceError') {
                                setTimeout(function () {
                                    try {
                                        dataLayer.dmd = dmdbDtmData;
                                    } catch (errorr) {
                                        if (errorr.name == 'ReferenceError') {
                                            setTimeout(function () {
                                                try {
                                                    dataLayer.dmd = dmdbDtmData;
                                                } catch (errorrr) {}
                                            }, 500);
                                        }
                                    }
                                }, 500);
                            }
                        }
                    }, 500);
                }
            }



            //Now save to Session Storage
            try {
                if (guid != null && guid != "" && guid != undefined) {
                    if (cookieCategories.indexOf(",2,") > -1) {
                        window.sessionStorage.setItem("dmdbDtm", JSON.stringify(dmdbDtmData));
                    }
                } else window.sessionStorage.setItem("dmdbDtm", JSON.stringify(dmdbDtmData));


            } catch (err) {}

        }
    });

}
